titles.title: Providing for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 4173) to provide for financial regulatory reform, to protect consumers and investors, to enhance Federal understanding of insurance issues, to regulate the over-the-counter derivatives markets, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-518, by Mr. Perlmutter.
All points of order against the conference report and against its consideration are waived.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 208.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1490.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 1490, the Chair put the question on adoption of the resolution and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Sessions demanded the yeas and nays, and the Chair postponed further proceedings on adoption of the resolution until later in the legislative day.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 234 - 189 (Roll no. 410).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/30/2010--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 4173) to provide for financial regulatory reform, to protect consumers and investors, to enhance Federal understanding of insurance issues, to regulate the over-the-counter derivatives markets.
